name: Eszter Csicsai
description: Project Director, Circular Economy at WSP USA
about: Network and program builder, circular economy believer.

experience.description: As Project Director in WSP USA's Circular Economy practice, I lead and support large-scale corporate sustainability projects aimed at building circularity strategy and business cases, reaching zero waste goals, determining the environmental impacts of circularity initiatives, and cultivating physical and digital systems for circularity. I also serve as SME in apparel/textiles circularity within the Circular Economy practice. Clients include Fortune 50 enterprises and major municipalities.

As the inaugural hire in this role, I developed Rheaply's offering of Sustainability Consulting services and tools, from the four-step modular service model to the proprietary Rheaply Circularity Assessment, which evaluates companies across 15 circularity success indicators. Rheaply's Sustainability Consulting service helps clients assess and quantify their circularity potential, build successful circularity programs, achieve meaningful ROI, and reach ambitious company goals.

As manager for the Americas region, I partnered closely with each of our 120+ SAC member companies in North and South America to strategize and scale usage of the Higg Index suite of end-to-end sustainability measurement tools throughout their supply chains, while deepening their engagement with the industry-transforming collective action of the Coalition. SAC members represent the apparel, footwear, and home textiles industry's leading brands, retailers, manufacturers, service providers, and NGOs working together to improve the industry's social and environmental outcomes. Founded in 2009 by Patagonia and Walmart, SAC membership has grown to over 270 global member companies - see the full list and learn about SAC's work at apparelcoalition.org .

Led the Reuse and Donations Unit within DSNY's Bureau of Recycling and Sustainability, driving materials reuse and circular economy programming to support the City's zero waste goals. In addition to leading the flagship donateNYC program and partnership network, deepening programmatic focus and capacity in apparel and textiles circularity, and leading circularity research and reporting efforts, accomplishments include overseeing the launch of the inaugural ReFashion Week NYC, organizing the cross-industry NYCxReuse materials reuse conference, and managing the launch of the world's first municipally-administered surplus food donation platform, the donateNYC Food Portal.

name: Tim Kittila, P.E.
description: Facilities Assessment Director at Kraus-Anderson
about: Licensed Professional Engineer focused on providing facility condition assessments and developing go-forward strategies for clients to achieve their organizational mission. The assessment services provides our customers with the in-depth reporting and documentation of existing facilities and its infrastructure.  We then can develop prioritized deferred maintenance options, develop concepts and options for new facility strategies, identify scope, develop detailed financial budget, provide detailed analysis of the various options, total cost of ownership, and develop a recommended project schedule, in order to bring a project to realization and creation.  Once projects progress past the assessment phase, the goal will be to provide and end-to-end reliability of the overall project scope, schedule and budget.  Our goal with an assessment is to help our customers identify their needs, identify their requirements, develop a scope, schedule and budget to help them "tell the story" of what they currently have and what they will need to do to meet their organizations overall strategy.

experience.description: Managing Kraus-Anderson's assessment practice for KA's key market sectors:  Education, Healthcare, Public Sector, Housing, Commercial and Special Projects groups.

name: Asha Garcia
description: Project Manager DNT Construction

experience.description: Managed all engineering activities for the design of custom-made combustion systems. Tasks of a project engineer include but are not limited to; the creation of process and instrumentation diagrams, making sure it follows all standards applicable to the local area where the system will be installed. Checking and approving manufacturing drawings, which includes the review of bills of materials, dimensions, scope of supply, etc. Creating data sheets for the selection of various instruments (i.e Pressure Regulators, Pressure Safety Valves, Thermocouples, among others.)  All this while ensuring to maintain the strict schedule for all deliverables specified in the purchase order.

Managed the planning, design and installation of customized metal shredding plants. As a design engineer, 3D models and manufacturing drawings on solid works were done for the fabrication of platforms, conveyors, air systems, rotors, among others. Bills of materials were created on finished designs. Inspected finished components on manufacturing floor. As project manager, tasks included the coordination between the internal departments of manufacturing, purchasing and engineering to created time lines, budgets and order of priorities. Manage the schedules, tasks and performance for a group of six engineers. Create reports on project progress for upper management as well as for customers. Most importantly serving as a connection point between the company, costumer and contractors for all on going projects.

education.description: Contractor, Wright Patterson Air Force Base 06/2011-08/2011
